properties.description: Airbnb announces its strategy to move more aggressively into the Asian market with the launch of their newest headquarters in Singapore. The company's goal is to acquire an additional 2 million properties within the continent.
properties.name: International expansion

properties.description: Brian Chesky and Joe Gebbia create the initial concept for AirBed & Breakfast during the Industrial Design Conference held by Industrial Designers Society of America.[1] The original site offers short-term living quarters, breakfast and a unique business networking opportunity for attendees who were unable to book a hotel in the saturated market.[2] Chesky and Gebbia themselves use Airbnb to help meet the rent for their loft in San Francisco.
properties.name: Idea creation

properties.description: Airbnb acquires Accoleo, a small German clone from Koblenz of its service, thereby expanding to Germany.
properties.name: Acquisitions by Airbnb

properties.description: Harvard University graduate and technical architect Nathan Blecharczyk joins as the third co-founder of AirBed & Breakfast.
properties.name: Team

properties.description: Airbnb is accepted into Y Combinator's Winter 2009 batch and receives $20,000 in funding. Y Combinator co-founder Paul Graham says that even though he is not a fan of Airbnb's idea, he is impressed by their creative methods for bootstrapping their funding situation by selling cereal.
properties.name: Funding

properties.description: Airbnb opens up its second international office in London in the United Kingdom.
properties.name: International expansion

properties.description: Airbnb receives $7.2 million in Series A funding from Greylock Partners and Sequoia Capital, and announces that out of 700,000 nights booked, 80% had occurred in the past six months.
properties.name: Funding

properties.description: Airbnb acquires NabeWise, a city guide that aggregates curated information for specified locations, in November 2012.[44] This acquisition shifts the company focus toward offering hyperlocal recommendations to travelers.
properties.name: Acquisitions by Airbnb

properties.description: Airbnb opens six international offices, in the cities Paris, Milan, Barcelona, Copenhagen, Moscow, and SÃ£o Paulo.[37] These are in addition to existing offices in San Francisco, London, Hamburg, and Berlin where Airbnb maintains its international presence for the EMEA markets within a German incubator space.
properties.name: International expansion

properties.description: Airbnb co-founder and CEO Chesky announces his focus on Australia, the second largest Airbnb market behind the United States, as well as Thailand and Indonesia. To support this effort, Airbnb opens its 11th office in Sydney.[41] The Australian consumer accounts for one-tenth of the Airbnb user base.
properties.name: International expansion

properties.description: Airbnb announces that European headquarters would be located in Dublin, Ireland.
properties.name: International expansion

properties.description: Airbnb announces plans to open a new "operational headquarters" for North America in Portland, Oregon, in summer 2014, but indicated that its main North American headquarters would remain in San Francisco.
properties.name: Company
